result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas E Uecker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay costs of the action. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact direct or indirect with Door Devils Motorcycle Club or its members.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.
Restitution has been paid in full.

timeConds.notes: 30 days of sentence are stayed to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Thomas E Uecker
Current: 836 Georgia Street, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 09-13-2016)
Prior: 920 Alabama Pl Apt 4, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Defendant Thomas E Uecker in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is prepared to proceed without counsel. State advises of payment in full of restitution and surcharge, moves to amend Count 1 to misdemeanor, advises of sentencing recommendation. Court reviews Victim Impact Statement, withholds sentence, imposes conditions of probation.

Court questions Defendant on progress with State. Defendant advises that it went good, presents guilty plea questionnaire. State advises of details of offer. Court questions Defendant on willingness to enter plea to felony that could be amended to misdemeanor, questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. Count 3 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Bond continues as is.

Defendant Thomas E Uecker in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 10:00 am.
for Documents, Affidavit in Support, Return

Defendant Thomas E Uecker in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises that Defendant waived right to Counsel, but never made an appointment with their office. Court questions Defendant, who misunderstood process, thought today would be date to see DA. Court questions Defendant, who has done nothing in last month. Court will give Defendant one more chance.  Status conference scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
No contact direct or indirect with officers of DDMC unless they consent in writing. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Thomas E Uecker in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
